text.content: GOING TO THE SWIMMING POOL
Juan and his sister Maria are excited because it’s a hot day in their neighborhood.
They put on their swimsuits and grab their towels.
Their mom gives them a backpack with water and snacks.
The pool is small but clean, and it’s their favorite place to cool off.
Juan jumps into the water first, and Maria follows.
They play with a ball and laugh a lot.
After swimming, they sit on the chairs to dry off.
Maria checks her phone to take pictures.
Their mom calls them to go home because it’s getting late.
They pack their things and say goodbye to their friends.
At home, they drink juice and rest on the sofa.
MY FRIEND PICKS ME UP IN A BIKE
Today, my friend Camilo is picking me up on his bike.
I need to wear my helmet because the streets are busy.
Camilo’s bike is old but strong, and it has a basket for our things.
We are going to the park to meet our friends.
I like to ride with Camilo because he is careful.
The sun is shining, and the wind feels nice.
We stop to buy ice_cream from a street vendor.
Camilo wants to try a new flavor, but I like chocolate.
At the park, we see kids playing soccer and flying_kites.
We sit on the grass and talk about our plans for the weekend.
When it’s time to go home, Camilo gives me a ride back.
MY NEW PET
My family and I are adopting a dog from the shelter.
We are calling him Bruno because it’s a strong name.
Right now, Bruno is playing with a ball in the yard.
He is small but very energetic, and he loves to run.
I am teaching him to fetch, but he doesn’t understand yet.
My mom is buying food and a collar for him.
Bruno is sleeping on the couch after playing so much.
Next week, we are taking him to the vet for a check-up.
I am so happy because Bruno is my first pet.
My friends are coming over to meet him tomorrow.
We are going to take Bruno for a walk in the park.
WHO IS MY SUPER HERO
My hero is my older brother, David.
He is taller and stronger than anyone I know.
David works as a mechanic, and he fixes cars every day.
He has to wake up early, but he never complains.
I think he might become the best mechanic in our town.
David wears a uniform and carries his tools everywhere.
Sometimes, he comes home with scratches, but he says it’s okay.
I want to be like him because he is kind and hardworking.
He may not wear a cape, but he is my superhero.
One day, I will help him in his shop and learn from him.
For now, I admire him and try to make him proud.
CONTROLLING MY CELPHONE TIME
I spend too much time on my phone, and my grades are dropping.
My mom says I have to change my habits, or she will take it away.
I am going to set a timer to limit my social media use.
The bus ride to school is when I waste the most time.
Instead of scrolling, I will read a book or listen to music.
My friend Sofia might join me in this challenge.
We will support each other and share our progress.
I think it will be hard at first, but I’ll get used to it.
My teacher says less screen time will help me focus.
By next month, I hope to see better results in my grades.
If I succeed, my mom will let me keep my phone.
PLANING MY FUTURE IN LOGISTICS
I need to decide what to study after high_school.
Logistics seems like a good choice because it’s in demand.
I have to research universities that offer this program.
My cousin works in a warehouse, and he says the pay is decent.
I must improve my math skills because it’s essential for logistics.
Next month, I am visiting a campus to learn more.
The application process may be competitive, but I’ll try my best.
My parents want me to succeed, so they support my decision.
I will attend workshops to prepare for the entrance exam.
By next year, I hope to be accepted into a good program.
This career might open doors to better opportunities for my family.
